instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915B: What is 820-2915B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight not working
threads.message:
Hi All,

This backlight problem has got me stumped.
No liquid spillage, that I can determine.

The laptop works fine, except no backlight until the laptop boots to the login screen.

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> = 3.4V

I replaced the backlight driver as i was out of iddeas. All resistors measure correct values around <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>.

Backlight enable is 3.3V from the get go. Makes no sense.

Any clues

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight not working
threads.message: Tried a known good LCD? What is backlight voltage? PWM and ENABLE present?
